title: Sea - Wikipedia
snippet: The sea is the interconnected system of all the Earth's oceanic waters, including the Atlantic, Pacific, Indian, Southern and Arctic Oceans. [1] However, the word "sea" can also be used for many specific, much smaller bodies of seawater, such as the North Sea or the Red Sea.

title: SEA Definition & Meaning - Merriam-Webster
snippet: The meaning of SEA is a great body of salt water that covers much of the earth; broadly : the waters of the earth as distinguished from the land and air. How to use sea in a sentence.

title: Sea - National Geographic Society
snippet: Oct 19, 2023 · The “seven seas” has been used to describe the world’s great water bodies for a long time. But there are actually about 50 water formations that can be called a “sea,” and they are quite diverse when it comes to their size, location, and ecosystems.

title: Sea: Definition, Meaning, and Examples - usdictionary.com
snippet: Jul 30, 2025 · A "sea" is often defined as a large body of saltwater, either forming part of the Earth's vast oceans or being partially enclosed by land. Examples include the Mediterranean Sea and the Black Sea.

title: Sea Definition & Meaning | Britannica Dictionary
snippet: SEA meaning: 1 : the salt water that covers much of the Earth's surface often used with the often used before another noun (literary); 2 : a large body of water that is part of the sea or that has land around part or all of it
